prompts: set up beads in this directory and familiarize yourself with this obsidian vault. save whatever insights you gleam to your memory using nornicdb and supermemory mcp. read through the files in @styleguide/ and your subagents dealing with obsdian formatting. there are quite a few of them, so review them all. your task is to parse through the entire vault and create bead issues for each markdown document in the vault instructing an AI cli agent to split the document into small chunks, and to manually read through it iteratively, making sure to identify, assess, address, and fix any formatting issues, or issues with latex equations, or spacing issues or line break issues, or header issues, using the edit tool to make targetted fixes to the parts of the document that contain errors, instead of just rewriting entire chunks of the document, and certainly not relying on scripts or automations that wantonly apply poorly concieved rules that may address the issue in one document, but which may likewise instroduce a host of new errors and formatting inconsistences across the entire vault, especcially given the AI has not even read or touched the other dcuments other than the one they are currently working on. anyways, use insights from the obsidian related skills and subagentts and commands to provide detailed instructions and guidelines for every bead issue, each of which corresponds to a single markdown file in the vault. instrucct the agent to also review the guidelines and details in the @styleguide/ folder, and also pass it further details and guidance and instructions of your own in the beads issues, and instruct the agent also to update the beads issue for the document after each chunk it processed in the document, and log every correction it made, what was the original mistaken formattd, and what the corrections it made and correct formatting that resulted. also instruct the agents to clear the existing tags in the yaml header, and come up with replacement key phrases to add as tags that are highly relevant to the contents of the markdown document, but which are no so specific so as to be singular across the entire vault, such as if it was a specific example rather than a key phrase that can be used to generate internal links across the vault by llinking to other documents.the tags should range from 1 to 2 per document for the smaller documents, to a maximum of 8-10 for the largest documents, with most files having somewhere from 3-5 tags/keyconcepts. also, tell the agent to clean up and fix the formatting of any tables of contents or outlines at the top of documents. anyways, these are just some of the details i want the agent sto pay close attention to when carrying out its task. add these and other details and insights into the beads. remember, under absolutely no condition are scripts or any other automation to be used when carrying out this task by the agent. THis is a high touch, fully manual task that will require the ai to not only read through each chunk of the documents iteratively, feom starr to finish, to understand its content aand use it to generate key phrases to be used as tags. Try to obtain a fairly equal distribution of tags/ key phrases across the markdown document, and don't just get all the tags from the top of th document and none from the bottom. anyways, please get to work creating the beads for each markdown file with all the information and details i provided. ultrathink. an ai cli agent should be able to, in a new session, just review the beads, understand their task fully, and all the details about how it should be executed, with no ambiguity or confusion.

ok, review all your skills, plugins, agents, subagents, commands, and everything else about obsidian formatting. @styleguide/ and create a comprehensive consolidated doc that will be passed on to a subagent working on a bead issue for a given file. be sure to be comprehensive, and to cover any gaps that i might have overlooked, like giving more insight into how specific tags should be. ideally, i prefer tags to be key phrases that are multi-word, like 2 or 3 words or maybe sometimes 4 words. also, the number of tags should vary depending on the length of the document. also, give instructions on how an agent parsing the document in small chunks is supposed to extract tags for the whole document, ie finding one or two key phrases from each chunk that captures the most important parts of the chunk, and then consolidating or ranking the key phrases from across all the chunks and selecting the most relevant and specific tags to the document. also, have the subagent process the documents in larger chunks, splitting the documents by level 1 markdown headers and combining them into groups of around 300-500 lines plus or minus a reasonable buffer, each each group will then be a chunk. also, remove key_concepts from the yaml header since it is kind of redunant. also, convert this prompt nto instructions for the subagents. i originally wrote it for you, but i want you to extract the details and guidelines for the subagent: instructing an AI CLI agent to split the document into
small chunks, and to manually read through it iteratively, making sure to identify, assess, address, and fix any
formatting issues, or issues with LaTeX equations, or spacing issues or line break issues, or header issues, using the
edit tool to make targeted fixes to the parts of the document that contain errors, instead of just rewriting entire
chunks of the document, and certainly not relying on scripts or automations that wantonly apply poorly conceived rules
that may address the issue in one document, but which may likewise introduce a host of new errors and formatting
inconsistencies across the entire vault, especially given the AI has not even read or touched the other documents other
than the one they are currently working on. Instruct the agent to also review the guidelines and details in the @styleguide/ folder,
and also pass it further details and guidance and instructions of your own in the bead issues, and instruct the agent
also to update the bead issue for the document after each chunk it processed in the document, and log every correction
 it made, what was the original mistaken formatted, and what the corrections it made and correct formatting that
resulted. Also instruct the agents to clear the existing tags in the YAML header, and come up with replacement key phrases to add as tags that are highly relevant to the contents of the markdown document, but which are not so specific
so as to be singular across the entire vault, such as if it was a specific example rather than a key phrase that can be
 used to generate internal links across the vault by linking to other documents. The tags should range from 1 to 2 per
document for the smaller documents, to a maximum of 8-10 for the largest documents, with most files having somewhere
from 3-5 tags/key concepts. Also, tell the agent to clean up and fix the formatting of any tables of contents or
outlines at the top of documents. Anyways, these are just some of the details I want the agent to pay close attention
to when carrying out its task. Add these and other details and insights into the beads. Remember, under absolutely no
condition are scripts or any other automation to be used when carrying out this task by the agent. This is a high
touch, fully manual task that will require the AI to not only read through each chunk of the documents iteratively,
from start to finish, to understand its content and use it to generate key phrases to be used as tags. Try to obtain a
 fairly equal distribution of tags/ key phrases across the markdown document, and don’t just get all the tags from the
top of the document and none from the bottom ultrathink

actually, have the subagents come up with primary tags, which should be limited to 1 to 10 dependening on the document length, and should be the most important tags or key phrases in the document that are most relevant to the document's contents, and secondary tags, which can go up to 25, and should be comprised of the next most relevant and important key phrases for the document. instruct the subagent to remove the tag key and key_concepts key from the yaml header, including all the values for them, and to  add both primary_tags and secondary_tags to the yaml header. the documents can range from 4000-5000 words on the lower end, to 450000 words on the higher end, but most documents are skewed towards the lower end. come up with a way to distribute the number of primary_tags and secondary_tags either based on the wordcount or number of chunks processed.
